pr_title: Use InjectableValue to provide response info

timeline.message: Use InjectableValue to provide response info
Use InjectableValue to provide response info
Use InjectableValue to provide response info
Use InjectableValue to provide response info

timeline.bodyText: This is the special case code that we had before.
timeline.author: bitwiseman
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -443,30 +445,6 @@ private static IOException interpretApiError(IOException e,
         return e;
     }
 
-    /**
-     * Sets the response headers on objects that need it. Ideally this would be handled by the objects themselves, but
-     * currently they do not have access to {@link GitHubResponse.ResponseInfo} after the
-     *
-     * @param responseInfo
-     *            the response info
-     * @param readValue
-     *            the object to consider adding headers to.
-     * @param <T>
-     *            type of the object
-     */
-    private static <T> void setResponseHeaders(GitHubResponse.ResponseInfo responseInfo, T readValue) {

timeline.bodyText: This is what we do instead of the special case.
timeline.author: bitwiseman
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -33,6 +34,19 @@
     GHObject() {
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Called by Jackson
+     * 
+     * @param responseInfo
+     *            the {@link GitHubResponse.ResponseInfo} to get headers from.
+     */
+    @JacksonInject
+    protected void setResponseHeaderFields(@CheckForNull GitHubResponse.ResponseInfo responseInfo) {

timeline.bodyText: Also, since we now have the the responseInfo injected during binding, we can make Record fully immutable.  We don't have "recalculate" after creation.
timeline.author: bitwiseman
